social_posts.post_text:
In the last month I have written an awful lot about love. 

Wait, you may be thinking, doesn't she always write an awful lot about love?

Yes—she does, it's true. But this feels different. Like I am now marking an indelible map toward what I believe, what I know, what I want, in a way that I never have. I am both writing my own mythology & unraveling it, at the very same time. 

What is true, despite my recent & very real grief, & acknowledging all of the loss that came before,  is that when I sit down to write about the love that I have known in this life - It is not the loss that lives at the center of the narrative. 

It is the holy miracle of the loving that returns to my fingers & spills onto the page, line after line, story after story.

Once, @lovestephaniegreene asked me what my very bravest thing was. 
“Love", I replied. "There is nothing braver in this whole wide world than the way I show up for love."

It’s my superpower, I think. The solid ground of me. The true north toward which my compass needle will always point (according to @jessa_red)

Has it caused me to stay too long in a space that did not offer me the fullness of reciprocity, with those that were no longer able to witness the magic & goddess of me? Has it been a source of self-abandonment as much as homecoming? Without a doubt.

But would I change this, the tenacity & surety of this knowing? Not as long as I am here & alive. Not as long as this heart of mine still beats & my body thrums with the pulse of desire. 

Yes, as I said in this essay “When this life of mine winds its way toward the end, when the stories of my living are done being written & recorded. When there is no longer time to edit in the name of creating a cleaner arc or a softer narrative. When all the saying is said & all the doing is done. When I am asked what I have known of love in this life, I do not believe I will tell you stories of heartbreak. 

I believe I will tell you that, in this life, I have been so very well loved. 

_______

Your tender desire for soul-deep intimacy and your rock-solid need for absolute sovereignty need not exist in conflict or contradiction. Cancel the myth that you can only have one or the other. What if you were never meant to choose? Close your eyes and imagine the roaring wild of you and the gentle home of you swirling in a dance of brilliant possibility where nothing was forbidden. Whisper the truth of your deepest desires to the open air. Gather your unruly truth and your holy want into the white-hot center of you. There is a love more free and affirming than you could have ever imagined. It speaks your language and knows your true name and will settle for nothing less than the whole of you. Wait for it. I promise. It will be everything.⁠
⁠
---⁠

You Are Everything. 

This is the name of my 2023 Wall Calendar (and will be the name of book #3)

Why? Because it’s true. You are.

Everything in the entire universe. In you. Of you. Around you. From you.

You are here. Alive. Breathing and loving and fucking up and trying again. Putting your heart and your soul and your oh-so-human body into the ring. Fighting and flying and waving the peace flag. Inviting us all to sit at your crowded kitchen table with a bottomless pot of soup and perfect crusty bread slathered with melted butter. Planting wildflowers in inhospitable ground and nurturing them into riotous bloom through sheer force of will.

You are it.

You. Are. Everything

I carefully selected the passages this year, as always, to create a collection of words that you can return to, month after month, to remind you of everything that you are.
Warrior.
Lover.
Artist.
God/dess.
Earth-Shaker.
Move-Maker.
Truth-Teller.
Wisdom-Seeker.
Hope-Giver.
Center-Of-The-Goddamn-Universe (and then some).

These words laid out with the same modern typography you have come to expect from my other creations, and will be paired with layered composite images, incorporating powerful humans, nature and more than a little bit of magic—because we are all compositions of our experiences, our understanding, the many versions of ourselves.

_____

Get one calendar for 30 (or five to take care of all of your dearhearts in the new year) for 120. 

Extremely limited quantities and I only place one order per year. ❤️❤️

Today, on substack, I am sharing a love story. 

But not a typical love story. This is not a story of falling in love or being in love or staying in love. This is a decade-old story of the end of a love, a desperate drive to the sea. It is the story of chance meeting with a stranger, and of ritual, and of the wisdom that has never left me, that forever altered the way I show up to meet the ending of a love story. Which, of course, is also always a beginning of something entirely new. 

This story was part of the saving of my broken heart. Part of my own survival. And thus, a forever part of the longest and deepest and most important love story I will ever live. The one that brings me home, again and again, to myself. 

This story is for you if you’ve got a broken heart right now 

This story is for you if you’ve ever housed a broken heart in the cage of your ribs that still aches like a phantom limb from time to time. 

This story is for you if you’re searching for a path for gratitude though some treacherous vines. 

This story is for you if you’re making your way back to yourself. 

This story is for you if you’re alive, and stubbornly insisting on a better way. 

I have once again recorded the entire essay for my paid subscribers. Think of it as a 20 minute bedtime meditation for aching and hopeful hearts. A prayer of grief and gratitude. A reminder of how much is possible when we hold ourselves well. 

If you are not yet a paid subscriber, my substack journal offers the only opportunity for readers to directly support my work and my ongoing creation. Your contributions to my path as a working writer and creative in this world are life changing and life giving. Please consider joining my circle. 

Read and listen at the link in bio. 

xo, 
jlb. ❤️

You have full permission to refuse:⁠
	1	externally defined rules designed to keep you small and afraid.⁠
	2	shame. for all of it.⁠
	3	dogma⁠
	4	old contracts that no longer reflect the truth of you.⁠
	5	limits on what you can say, how you can dress or the pathways to your pleasure.⁠
	6	unkind mirrors hellbent on seeing your worst possible reflection.⁠
	7	your own past ideas or proclamations of what you wanted or needed.⁠
	8	old stories and outdated myths that do not serve your new evolution.⁠
	9	any damn thing you please.⁠
xo. jlb. ⁠
⁠

i.
It cracks my heart open to think of us out there, wandering the world, deeply hungry to be known. It's the most beautiful thing, this universal human longing. We have not given up that we might one day taste it, at least some sense of it. However brief. However transient. However impossible to hold. It might be out there, so we keep seeking. 

This, to me, is tremendously, tenderly, beautiful.

ii.
“Direct gaze into yourself. See straight through to the other side. Mythologize. Put yourself back together the best you can. With paint. With pen. With purpose. Don’t flinch. Reinvent. whenever facing the impossible–– Never say die: Unfurl. Fling. Flare. Fly”
‘IMAGINING FRIDA KAHLO AS MY LIFE COACH’
@glenismakingpoetryreign

iii.
Why, with all I’ve given myself permission for, do I still feel like I need approval to just be angry? To be upset. to name wrong, to rage & howl & say no, this was not okay, it is not okay, it will not be okay. 

There is a growth edge here, I know. I let myself sit closer to it than I have before. Gift it language. Let it be what it is. And I learn.

iv.
We write each other daily. I would say text, but that isn’t correct. We write. Still digital, letters on a screen sent by the kind of magic we call technology across so many thousands of miles. But time slows. Contemplation given. The words chosen matter. The messages span the mundanity of entirely ordinary days, but poetry is tucked into the lines. Poetry, & true answers to honest questions. This grows & answers something in me. It is correspondence, yes, but also a practice of something different. And it is beautiful. 

v.
Realize everything you are, in this letter, precedes you—which is the loneliness of writing. What you want is never now. That’s the essence of desire.
How to Write an Erotic Letter
Anthony Farrington

vi.
I am writing something different & deliciously fun. Erotic sapphic vampire intrigue? Don’t mind if I do. 

vii.
One way I have come to understand the definition of healing: 
I become less enamored with the story I want to write, & make peace with–fall headlong into—the one I’m actually living.

ix.
Break up 
Break down
Break in 
Break out 
Break through 
Break free

My second book '𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐀𝐫𝐞 𝐄𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡: 𝐋𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐍𝐨𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐎𝐧 𝐒𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐭𝐲, 𝐏𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐮𝐫𝐞, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐏𝐨𝐰𝐞𝐫' is available for preorder!⁠
⁠
My first book was a labor of love. To say there was blood, sweat, & (more than an ocean of) tears involved is not something I say metaphorically. I poured the entirety of myself into that book, laid my heart on every page. ⁠

After all the hesitation (+resistance, excuses, and hesitation) I’ve spent the last month giving my all to create something deeply important to me. ⁠
⁠
Yup. I’m going to do it again.⁠
⁠
𝐈’𝐦 𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐬𝐚𝐦𝐞 𝐰𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐈 𝐰𝐚𝐬 𝐰𝐡𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐟𝐢𝐫𝐬𝐭 𝐛𝐨𝐨𝐤 𝐰𝐚𝐬 𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐧:⁠
I’ve gone deeper and fought harder and come out of more closets than I imagined. I’ve fallen in and out of love. I’ve broken my heart and saved it. I’ve lost my way and found myself. I’ve written hundreds of thousands of words along the way.  I hope these years have made me a better writer, but I KNOW they’ve made me a braver writer.⁠
⁠
𝐀𝐧𝐝 𝐈 𝐚𝐦 𝐰𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐚 𝐝𝐚𝐦𝐧 𝐛𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐞 𝐛𝐨𝐨𝐤.⁠
⁠
𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐬 𝐦𝐲 𝐯𝐨𝐰 𝐭𝐨 𝐲𝐨𝐮:⁠
Intend to dig deeper, push harder and expect more of myself. And I am going to write my broken and whole, heretical and holy, sovereign AF heart out again. ⁠
⁠
𝐁𝐮𝐭 𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞’𝐬 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐭𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐡: ⁠
I cannot do it without you. If there is a lesson the universe has hit me with again & again in recent years, it’s that I need to stop being so damn stupidly stubborn about asking for (& receiving) support, assistance, & abundance. ⁠
⁠
So yes, I am going to self-publish this book. But I don’t want to do it all alone this time around. ⁠
⁠
Self-publishing takes a tremendous amount of time, resourcing, & logistical support. And because I want to do this well & do this right, I’m writing today to ask you to be a part of the creation, from start to finish. To support me in birthing this book into the world.⁠
⁠
I want you on my team, from the starting flag all the way to the finish line. ⁠
⁠
𝐏𝐥𝐞𝐚𝐬𝐞 𝐛𝐞 𝐚 𝐩𝐚𝐫𝐭 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐭𝐡 𝐦𝐞. ⁠
𝐈𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐦𝐞𝐚𝐧 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐫𝐞 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐥𝐝. ⁠

https://bit.ly/youareenoughpreorder (link in bio) 

xo.⁠

You don't have to be a “well behaved” woman. No nice girls for me. Give me your outcasts and your witches. Your dykes and your butches and every last one who refused to conform to the script they were handed at birth. Take me to your untamable and uncontrollable and unfuckwithable. Find me the ones who never met a rule they wouldn’t break. I want to sit in circle with the midwives and the healers. With the whores and the dancers. The ones who chose the terms of their own inevitable exploitation and alchemized it into the keys to the cage. Give me the ones you chained and burned and left for dead. Send me the princess who rescued the prince and left him to fend for himself because she had better things to do.⁠
⁠
---⁠

Have you ever experienced the way time can provide us with a new ending for a hard story. Perhaps a more gentle ending, a softer reflection, a kinder lens?

A brand new essay on the ways time can provide us with new endings for hard stories is winding it’s way to inboxes right now. 

If you’re not on the list yet - you can read the full essay (and subscribe so you don’t miss future writing) via the link in my bio. 

I’m sharing a short excerpt and recording here - a recounting of one of the most beautiful and heartbreaking loves of my life, or you can head over and subscribe to read the entire piece (full recording available only for my paying supporters). 

“The song plays in my current right now while I sit here on my bed, tarot decks readied for ritual. Instead, I am transported. Lost and found. I am here and also there, back then, with her. Spiraled into another lifetime, another body, another dream that could have, might have, would have been. 

“You feel like beauty,” she said to me that day, as her fingers grazed the line of my spine.

Down, down, down, she went/I went/we went. 

My breath is tight in my lungs. I am underwater, I am drowning, I am made liquid by desire. All I want to do is keep spiraling deeper. All I want is to keep spiraling.

All I want, all I want, all I want, is her. 

When the meeting of such a stunning want is more than enough to sustain life, who on earth needs air?

“Everything whispers I love you” I whispered a little while later, sometime after we surfaced and let air once again flood our lungs. 
That wasn’t my line, of course, I stole it from another poet*. But I meant it then, with all that I had.

Lovers are the best and worst kind of thieves, you know. “

PS: Writers: Don’t miss this weeks writing prompt at the bottom of the essay ✒️

i.
I woke up naturally before sunrise. I love waking up when it is still dark out, sinking into the liminal in-between. Today I woke to the sound of rain, which never feels anything less than a miracle in this desert home of mine.

I grew up on the East Coast of Canada, never more than a short walk to the ocean. Rain was a constant. It never once felt like a miracle, but rather something that thwarted plans & killed enjoyment.

Isn’t it incredible, I think to myself, still cozied in bed under both weighted blanket & down duvet, how what we name miracle may just be a measure of what we cannot easily reach.

ii.
just announced a live two-part workshop to help you write your way out of the year that has passed & into the year yet to come. You can check it out here. I would love to have you join me to reflect on the wisdom of all you’ve created in 2022 & to chart a course for creative sovereignty in 2023.

iii.
A text I sent this week. I've rarely written anything more true.

iv.
I spent a lot of time in the past year trying to work out the trick of writing a true story about love. 

I think I may have been coming at the whole thing a little sideways. 

You see, it’s awfully hard to live a true love story when you’re focusing your attention on the love story you want to write. 

v.
The steadfast practice of being with what is real is one of the truest ways I have come to understand the nature of reverence. 

xv.
Staying, when you know you need to leave, is not a kindness to anyone. Least of all yourself. 

But leaving, when everything in you wants to find a reason to stay, requires more kindness than you can possibly imagine. 

We think we need strength & bravery to leave. I wonder if what we need is more softness. 

If you need to leave, dig deep for every ounce of grace & mercy you have to muster. You’re going to need it.

xix.
I’ll choose a hard truth over a gentle lie.
Every single time.

This Is What I Know To Be For Me Right Now is a weekly a love list of the things that are most alive for me & in me right now. I’d love to see you create your own. What is alive & true for you?

What a year it has been. 

Which is, I suppose, true of all the years that I have ever lived and all that I have yet to come. We made it through another one, my lovelies. And I don’t know what else is more worth celebration than that.

I have lived - and written - a year’s worth of stories. Loved and lost and found. Healed and hurt and harmed. Grappled and fought hard and let go. I’ve been loved fiercely and I’ve hurt deeply and, as always, I have found, in myself, a worthy home to return to at the end of every journey. 

I selected  the clips for this reel quickly and randomly. And, as one could expect, they represent but a fragment of the memories I will carry with me from this year.  And I am poignantly aware that some stories are not represented here at all, having reached the completion of their trajectory and belonging to sacred space. Their absence from the roundup is not a reflection of the place they retain in my heart.  We can’t ever tell the totality of a story in a space like this. It’s a fool’s errand to even try. All we can do is give a glimpse, to make it as honest as we are able, to try to do the gift of living justice both in what we share, and what we hold close to our hearts by choice or necessity. 

To *everyone* who has been a piece of my journey this year, thank you. Known or unknown to me, you are a part of what keeps me here, what keeps me showing up for the writing and the loving and the living of this singular life I’ve been given. 

My gratitude for the honor of that knows no bounds.   I will catch you on the flip side, my darling fellow humans, shining beacons of the brightest light, every last one of you.

Guess what? You get to want things.⁠
⁠
Objects. People. Adventure. Sex. Change. Pleasure. Danger. Things you can't even name.⁠
⁠
Like really, really want. Way down deep. Screw those commandments—you, my dear, have permission to covet. To crave. To center yourself on some down-and-dirty-holy-as-fuck human desire.⁠
⁠
And here's the even better part, the alchemy of the whole damn magical business (lean into this one with me, now, and let it blow your mind).⁠
⁠
You get to have them too.⁠
———-

PS; Wanting is one thing. But giving ourselves the permission to have, to allow, to receive - that's the tricky bitch. Especially in a year like the one we've been living. ⁠
⁠

It is about creativity and dancing with the muse and releasing the stories that have been burning in your belly, begging for release. ⁠

This work is about the freedom of coming clean and the sovereignty waiting for you on the other side.⁠

If what I create does not move you somewhere inexplicable & way down deep.

If it does not turn you on & somehow make you question, & wonder, & seek. 

If it does not inspire you to create or make you more deeply feel the full wildness of your existence. 

If it does not land in your body like a magic spell crafted to bring you back to life, I am definitively not the woman for you.

________

Are you an artist? (meaning you see beyond the surface & somehow translate that knowing into something visible or tangible or auditory or energetic or healing that would not have existed in this exact way were you not here & alive on this earth)

If you are an artist (no matter if it's born on paper or canvas or song or food for your family or the creation of beautiful space or the precise way you show up to the loving of this life) & the humans in your life do not get your art (not just get it, but celebrate it, luxuriate in it, lift it up, make way for it, clear space for it, pay homage to what it takes to birth it into the world) then let me suggest they are not the humans for you. 

Devote yourself to calling in a collective that recognizes the tenacity it takes to make something out of nothing. 

A community that understands that by devoting yourself to the creation of art, you are one of the forces that will save us from ourselves. 

Friends well versed in the coaxing of the embers of your inspiration into a blazing fire of creation. 

A lover who burns for your art - one who exalts the spark within you that allows you to bring beauty into this existence. 

A muse who will dance with you long into the darkening night. 

You’ll keep making what you make either way, my dear. 
You know that & so do I. 
You couldn’t stop if you tried. 

So remember, you deserve to do it encircled by more than simple acceptance. 
Tolerance of your creative process will not suffice.
Surround yourself with those who breathe life into you & your art, not the ones who pull the air from the rooms within you. 

Draw a line in the sand, define your space, and claim the necessity of your art. 
Demand that those who seek you do the same. 

----

do you remember that day? when you placed the keys in my hands and said "please take me somewhere bigger than this". I drove us down the wide-open road, you singing Janis Joplin and me performing a one-armed air guitar solo. we rolled out of town that morning like we were kids on a dare with nothing better to do, and i suppose in most ways we were. the mountains were wrapped in mist and the desert sky was hot as hell and icy blue at the same time and somehow everything suddenly made sense. we turned enough blind corners that day that we should have gotten lost, but somehow it only felt like finding everything i didn't know I was missing. yes, i know that sounds cheesy as hell now, but i also know it sounds true and I'm finally old enough to put some faith in the truth. do you remember how alive we were and how ridiculously improbable it all felt, that we would be there and giddy in love and so impossibly young that nothing could possibly touch us? my god, how we laughed. how we wanted, like the world hadn't yet told us not to. remember how i pulled the car into that grove of olive trees just in time for the sun to explode into fire on the horizon. our bodies lit like so many lightning bolts finding ground and everything in us said yes and rolled earthquake and all we could think that day was how much we wanted to taste more of whatever this was. because as young as we were and as much as we knew it wouldn't last, we were not yet too wise to let the longing be our undoing. still smart enough to know magic when we felt it. still alive enough to get naked on the side of the freeway and howl at the rising moon and let loose the wild in our chests. still close enough to our knowing to claim every last bit.

—————

WRITING PROMPT - DO YOU REMEMBER THE DAY
Tip: don't try to think of a certain day or memory, simply write this line at the top of an empty page and see what  begins to flow. And remember, it's often the seemingly ordinary days that hold the most beautiful richness, so allow yourself to be surprised by what you remember (and how you remember it).

Inconvenient truth:⁠
It doesn’t matter how much air you blow into the lungs of love when its heart has already stopped beating.⁠
⁠
--------⁠
⁠
There are many lessons this life has circled me back to, again and again. Most of them, it seems, have something to do with love. ⁠
⁠
Most of everything about this whole being alive journey, it appears, has something to do with love. ⁠
⁠
I have learned (more than once) that when I’m struggling to grip tightly to my idea of what a thing should be, I fail to get quiet and sit with what my body already knows about what it really is. It is almost always true that my body knows far before I admit to the knowing. ⁠
⁠
Oh, what beautiful and brave and foolish creatures we are to imagine that we could ever have so much power over something as sovereign and uncontrollable as a story. ⁠
⁠
Especially a story about love. ⁠
⁠
I remind myself now to not rush to write a story before it has had sufficient time to tell itself. ⁠
⁠
Relinquish control, loosen my grip, surrender to the mystery.⁠
⁠
Because love, like language, is damn good at refusing to be boxed in. ⁠
⁠
As my dear friend Kai Skye (@brianandreas) once told me. ⁠
"I would say that all love stories end well. Sometimes it takes longer to see how they were exactly perfect…"⁠
⁠
It’s true that loving hasn’t landed me anywhere near where I imagined I would be right now. ⁠
⁠
But I understand that it is still, somehow, perfect. ⁠
⁠
<<This brand new essay landed in inboxes yesterday. Not yet on the list? Subscribe on substack via the link in my bio>>⁠
⁠

It is almost the middle of January, so how about we drop the promises and resolutions, and expectations for now? How about we agree to not have so many projections on who you are or who I am or who either of us will become before the days shorten again? Because no doubt I’ll stumble and trip a few times, guaranteed. And maybe you will, too. This many trips around the sun and I’m humble enough to know that for sure. But I always get up again. So do you. We know this because we are still here. Can you believe we are both still here? Can you remind me of that when I forget? Remind me of the miracle of it, I mean. Maybe all we do this year is just promise to show up for each other, you and I. Show up full force, I mean. Hearts on our sleeves and hot soup on the table and arms at the ready with a soft place to fall. I’ll bring my messy humanity and my paradox and my contradictions and my holy gifts and my deep-down desire to breathe more, love deeply, and create fully. You bring your magic and your laser-sharp lessons and your grace and your way of moving us through, no matter what. Let's hit the open road more often maybe, and laugh a little more, and take this ride just a little less seriously but a whole lot more tenderly. Let's make our only resolution look like a fierce sort of grace, and let's just see what we make of that.⁠
⁠
----⁠

ii.
To be responsive is to confirm presence. To remember is to name important. To say that we matter to one another. That we don’t need to erect a billboard to claim attention, to be met, to be worthy of response. That just being is enough.

When we say that like/need/want/wish for/can’t stand something, and it is repeated, memorized, returned to us as an offering full of gentle hope—we are all ever so slightly undone.

iii.
I do not know if I was confused or simply not yet ready to know. That’s the way of things when we are faced with an unwanted but indelible shift in the through-line of the story we’ve been living.

We don’t always have all the information we need to make sense of the arc in the minute-to-minute of living. It is in retrospect, in gazing back, that the lines become clear.

Later we can let the full significance land fully, & only then do we admit what we did not wish to know.

And in that moment of surrender, the story shifts for real.

vii.
“Creativity is queer. As in ubiquitous, non-hierarchical, fluid. Creativity is mad, As in, non-assimilated, Divergent. Paradigm Shifting. Let’s put it this way. Creativity is thread-like. Thousands of archers long, greater fungal organisms beneath the forest floor. Art is the fruiting body. The mushroom.” @cristinarombi

ix.
Did you know that heresy is derived from the greek word haíresis which actually means choice? 

To be heretical is to claim your right to sovereign choice. 

To say that the religion of my childhood may no longer gatekeep the language of all my todays. 

To speak the words of scripture as reclamation instead of condemnation, bring them into your throat & swallow them whole, swirl the language of judgment and shame around in your belly, let them grow new roots.

To be heretical is to remake meaning to suit yourself. 

xix.
“There will always be a person who looks like a poem the earth wrote to keep you alive.”
@theboywhocrieswolf 

And when you get really solid, if you’re lucky, that person will be you.

Do you hear me, love?
That person can be you.

We are 2 weeks into a brand new year, this feels like a good time to say hello. 

What can I tell you that’s not already out there, in the online wilds, waiting to be found?

Maybe it’s not necessary to say anything new, & the whole point is to keep writing until I fully integrate it all. Maybe there is nothing truly new to write, it’s just discovery & excavation & evolution until the end. 

We humans keep grappling with the same themes. They drive the plot of books & the course of international conflict & the interplay between humans navigating the complexity of time & space. 

Love. Grief. Desire. Anger. Betrayal. Shame. Bliss. We circle—tangle—dance in the complex web built of threads that link us all. 

We ask: 
Where did I come from? What do I believe?
Where do I belong? How can I find my way back there?
Why does it hurt? How will I survive?
What is the secret of happiness? Of lasting love? Of purpose?
Do you see me? Please do you see me?

There’s nothing I write that you haven’t read, considered, or dreamed. I don’t have wisdom that doesn’t already live in the heart, bones & breath of you. I’m absolutely unique, but only because you are too. Isn’t that glorious, entirely?

But what of me right now?
I’ll take a hard truth over a gentle lie, every single time.
I write to make peace with reality, or to make peace with the way no peace can be made.
I drive a cherry red jeep—the dial is always tuned to country radio. 
I’m still learning that wanting a thing to be true does not make it so. 
Sometimes the wildest choice I make is to stay entirely still. 
My contract with self involves saying yes when I can, my hard no's are few. I will never stop exploring the edges. 
I believe endlessly, in a way that is utterly unchangeable, in the power of love.
I believe just as strongly that when I wander I will return to myself, to center, to the home I have built in this body of mine. 
I no longer ask for permission, but I often still forget that the permission lives in me. 
Everything I write is an invitation: not just into my truth, but into your own.

After the battle. After the triage. After the healing, it takes a while to find ground again. But we do. We always do, somehow. And can we just agree that a heart coming back to life slowly is a gentle and hopeful and impossibly tender thing? And can we also agree that it’s the most beautiful and powerful thing of all, the way our hearts do this? ⁠
⁠
“Go easy on me”, we whisper to the newness, “it’s been a little while since I've opened my mouth to taste what might become something lovely”. But did you know that once the ocean made its home in the desert? That there are seashells nestled below Saguaro? How can we not believe in our own tenacious magic once we come to know a thing like that.⁠
⁠
So be gentle. But don’t hold back. This time our hearts are tender and resolved. They want everything, but no longer ask for a single answer beyond the ones they stumble into along the way. Those answers can’t be called anything but honest.⁠
⁠
A story ends and one is just beginning. No, a hundred are just beginning. Maybe a thousand or a million or more. Just like they always do. No matter what, they always do.⁠
⁠
-----⁠
⁠

1. pleasure is generative⁠
2. hedonism is holy⁠
3. your body was made to feel good⁠
4. desire is your pathway home⁠
5. shame is the enemy of sovereignty⁠
6. you are allowed to want what you want⁠
7. sex can be a portal to divinity ⁠
8. your life and your body belong to you⁠
9. the time for waiting for permission is over.⁠
⁠
You were born into a body that craved safe touch and deep pleasure from day one. ⁠
⁠
Your shame? That came later—an unwanted gift of culture and religion and the patriarchy. ⁠
⁠
Fact: Your shame serves nobody. ⁠It is the enemy of sovereignty. The villain of the narrative. The evil mastermind plotting the demise of so much possible goodness. ⁠
⁠
But your pleasure? Your pleasure (pure and unadulterated and not filtered through guilt or the need to hide or deny—which is where pleasure gets warped into an ugly selfish entity) serves you entirely. You and me and all of us. ⁠
⁠
That alone is reason enough to take it⁠ when it is offered to you and to throw yourself into the glory of knowing how it tastes and feels and unfolds in your body (and mind and heart and spirit).⁠
⁠
That alone is reason enough to devote your entire presence toward alchemizing anything that prevents you from bending yourself fully into what calls to the whole of you.⁠
⁠
That alone is reason enough to rip up the pages that separated you from what you desire, grab the pen, and write a new story meant just for you.⁠
⁠
⁠
-------⁠
⁠
What would you add to this list of truths? ⁠
⁠
As the author of your own life (which includes your stories around pleasure) It's time to stop asking for permission. ⁠To take back control of the narrative.  To write a new pleasure story just for you.⁠
⁠
As Glinda The Good Witch so aptly said "You had the power all along, my dear".⁠

I woke up late and instead of heading right to work I decided to water my plants. I found that my lovely spider plant was struggling a little and decided to replant it into another, more suitable pot. One with a little more room and better drainage. ⁠
⁠
The problem with replanting is that each time you rehouse one plant, you’re left with a new home, perfect for another (it’s rather like the story I’ve read about hermit crabs, lining up in perfect size order, ready to take the new hand-me-down safe house passed their way).⁠
⁠
So there I was, still in my pajamas and borrowed cozy sweater, dining room table covered in trays and pots and rocks and dirt. Replanting one, putting some shoots into water to propagate new babies, holding up the now empty pot, and looking around to see which growing plant member of my mini jungle family would fit best in this newly empty home. ⁠
⁠
Toward the end, I misjudged. I removed one plant from a pot, in which it was arguably quite content, but not quite lining up with the vibe of my bedroom.⁠
⁠
I replanted some new pothos babies into that newly empty pot and found them a home in which they better fit their surroundings. I came back to the original, now homeless plant and perused the remaining available pots. ⁠
⁠
Dammit, I didn’t have anything left quite big enough. ⁠
⁠
I did the best I could. Found the biggest empty pot I could locate, and stuffed that plant in there as best as I could manage. ⁠
⁠
I could tell he wouldn't be happy long. His base protruded out of the top of the soil. He listed gently to the side. I vowed out loud I’d find him a better home soon.⁠
⁠
I started to think about all the ways we cram ourselves into too small pots, just because that is what is available. Or because we don’t even realize how big we’ve grown or how expansive we already are. ⁠
⁠
We select a pot (or accept the one selected for us) because it looks good enough, or it appears to be the kind of beautiful we’d always dreamed of becoming. ⁠
⁠
Why do we say yes to a life that is so much smaller than the one we truly need?...⁠
⁠
Read (and listen to)the rest of the essay (and my musings on why we do this) over on substack (link in bio)

In this life, 
The move toward connection is everything.⁠
It’s a stupendous act of blind faith,
A litany of hope,⁠
A miracle of tender forgiveness.⁠
It’s Jon Cusack and his ghetto blaster laying it all on the line. 
And Tom Cruise being so completely had at hello.
It’s every last time you’ve ever said yes ⁠
knowing for sure that the only thing we can rest on ⁠
is the fact that this all ends.⁠
It’s in the way the human heart ⁠
extends again and again ⁠
into the abyss.⁠
The way we’ve been sending probes ⁠
and animals and people into space for decades ⁠
and we still have not stopped dreaming ⁠
one day someone will send something back ⁠
to the tenacious hope of our open arms, ⁠
just so we can know for sure that we are not alone.⁠
We haven’t ever been alone here, love.
When everything feels lost ⁠
there is only one way to be found.⁠
Lean In.⁠
⁠
xo, @jeanetteleblanc⁠
⁠

Decline any love
that requires
a compromise of spirit.
The love that will
feed your soul
& fuel your fire
is one that offers
full agency over your heart,
your body,
your creativity,
& your life.
Remember,
your love is a gift,
is a truth,
is a holy, sacred thing.

This life will offer you countless opportunities to learn what it means to show up for yourself, to act in accordance with your sovereign truth, to take the lead in your dance with your own worthiness. 

Compromising to maintain relationships, to not lose love, to stay within the illusion of safety is part of the journey. Every last one of us does it. Most of us do it multiple times. 

I have &  I do &  I am sure I will again, It’s just a consequence of being human, & I ain’t got nothing but grace left for that. 

We are creatures of connection, built for union, made for co-regulation &  community. Of course, we do not want to walk away. Of course, we double down &  lay it all on the line. This isn’t failure or weakness, I expect no less of myself &  I expect no less of you. 

I know this to be true: The connections that bring us into healing, offer us the spaciousness to explore, expand & grow do NOT leave us feeling as if we are constantly folded in on ourselves.

As Rilke said,
“I don’t want to stay folded 
  anywhere,
because where I am folded, 
  there I am a lie.
 &  I want my 
grasp of things 
  to be
  true”

What is more, those relationships only hold when we are folded, when we bend, contort & diminish ourselves to fit. 

If you wonder, love, try unfolding. Stretch into the edges of the space you hold. Unfurl your wings. Loosen your grip. Expand into the whole of you. 

Does your lover show up to worship with a fervent sort of gratitude, the willingness to do the real work, the keys to unlock every last cage? Do they show up seeking the same?

No? Then, I promise, this love is not near enough for you.
Staying in a space not meant to hold requires a powerful sort of denial. 

I think you’re ready to see what happens when you allow your grasp of things to be true. 

------

Listen, ⁠
I'm a DEEPLY feeling human. There are a hell of a lot of times I'd like to be tough and hard and give no fucks (truth: I give a lot of fucks. all of the time). But that's not the way I was made. And I couldn't love or show up or make this art the way I do if I wasn't brought to blazing life and broken down a hundred times a day. ⁠
⁠
I'm chaotic and disorganized and wear my heart on my sleeve. I love hard and often, and without apology, and I get my heart broken on the regular (by loss, yes, but also by how impossibly beautiful and brief and miraculous it all really is). ⁠
⁠
I do NOT have it all under control. I do NOT have it all figured out. I'm deep in the wild, confusing (and ultimately uncontrollable) mess of it all, just like you.⁠
⁠
What DO I have? A wildly expressive, fundamentally tender, tenaciously stubborn as fuck heart. An irrepressibly optimistic, hopeful-enough-to-be-my-own-occasional-downfall spirit. A body that seeks novelty and experience and that experiences the world as both indescribably painful and infinitely pleasurable, all at once.  A soul that feels it all, every last bit.⁠
⁠
And I am strong. My softness hasn’t prevented me from surviving this life. It is the reason I am still here. ⁠
⁠
So I'm here to tell you that yes, you can allow yourself to be soft, to be messy, to be sensitive and vulnerable and broken wide open, and still feel that white-hot core of strength that lives and breathes inside you. You don’t need to be tough or hard or forever in control.⁠
⁠
Your gentleness is not a sign of weakness.⁠
⁠
Your softness is where the core of your strength resides.⁠
⁠
______⁠

i.
If you're going to love an artist, best be prepared to show up in the art.
If you’re going to do wrong by an artist, best be prepared to show up in the art.

ii.
A story cannot be true if you skip all the hard. Gloss over plot holes. Write through inconsistencies with blinders on. This builds a pretty, but poorly-written, fairy tale. A collection of make-believe words forming an epic, but ultimately untrustworthy, myth.

iii.
“Looking back to retrieve memory is always an act of creation. @lidiamiles

v.
We cannot hope to ever write an entirely factual account of a thing. We must write the most real, whole, true version accessible. The one that tells the story we need to tell to survive & heal. That helps us set things right inside, make sense of the chaos & knit the fragments together into something meaningful. A narrative we can offer with open hands, saying “I did my best to tell this as I lived it. I hope that it is enough”.

vii.
“The evidence against you is not damning.”
@mikkoharvey

The evidence against you is not damning. This is another way of saying redemption is everywhere, forgiveness is possible, we are all better than our worst moments, or at the very least we are not wholly defined by them. If this is all true (& I believe that it is), a hell of a lot is possible.

x.
How often we look to another to remind us of our vastness. We hope to discover, inside the container of relationship, the full expansiveness of self. Right now I am learning (no, remembering) what it is to know & trust in my vastness. Sometimes endings dissolve illusions, & in that disillusionment, we are once again revealed, whole, boundless, entirely without limits.

Remembering ourselves is the most beautiful thing. Even more beautiful, I believe, than falling in love.

xv.
The edge? It’s a portal to the muse. To creativity & sex & the vastness I hold in this body of mine. I am entirely here for it.

xvi.

Know what?⁠
You are a world-class expert in the fine art of saving yourself.⁠
⁠
Yes, I know you often rather feel like you are the world's foremost expert at breaking your own damn heart. But bear with me here:⁠
⁠
If we are so good at breaking our own good hearts (and yes, this is arguably true) but yet we are still here—living & loving & feeling the tender rise of hope (yet again & again & miraculously again), then it goes to figure that we must be damn good at saving ourselves too. ⁠
⁠
So okay, we've all—in our own ways—been complicit in each experience of heartbreak. We have all been the instigator of our own undoing. ⁠
⁠
But know what? We're experts in the healing too, me and you.  Remember that, love, when you're tempted to blame yourself for the choices you have made. ⁠
⁠
Remember you are also able to gather up all the broken pieces and rock them gently and speak their names and cry them wholly and save yourself. You have before and you will again. ⁠
⁠
You may be the source of your own breaking, it's true, but you are also the root of your eternal becoming. ⁠
⁠
So, speak what needs to be spoken. Wail at the heavens. Make peace with the things you name mistakes and leave space for them to transform into wisdom. ⁠
⁠
And steady up, love. Your heart knows how to bend into the holy break, and it knows how to weave itself back together again. There is redemption everywhere. Even here. Even now. Even for you. I promise. ⁠
⁠
Remember—so often, these all of these heartbreaks are just another step on the path to saving ourselves. And that takes a wild sort of courage, every single time.⁠
⁠
----⁠

⁠
If you are putting pen to paper or fingers to keyboard or joining letters into words & words into sentences in the quiet safety of your mind, then you, my dear, are a writer. ⁠

Now get writing. The world is waiting for your story, my love. And nobody can tell it but you.⁠

We’ve always been more wild and wanton dandelion seed than stationary oak tree. ⁠
More hardly pothos than delicate lily.⁠
⁠
Clip our growth and we’ll send down new roots. ⁠
Attempt to contain us and we’ll ultimately break free. ⁠
Yes, we’re scrappy, you and I. ⁠
⁠
We’ll root down in hardy soil. ⁠
We’ll pull our survival from the rocks if we need to. ⁠
⁠
But what if we didn’t need to? ⁠
What if we could begin to choose the nature of our own thriving aliveness? ⁠
What if we turned ourselves again and again toward the path of the sun? ⁠
What if we took a good long look at where we are planted and made the hard and holy call to build a brand new home? ⁠
⁠
Extend your roots deep and wide, love.⁠
Let the force of your growth shatter the pot that has been your confinement. ⁠
Send a million new shoots up through the soil. ⁠
⁠
Let the vines of you climb whatever is close enough until you grow through the canopy and reach for the light.⁠
Open your face to the sun and bloom with wild abandon. ⁠
Take up so much space. ⁠
⁠
You are the tree of knowledge. ⁠
You are a rainforest of holy. ⁠
You are the heart of the jungle itself. ⁠
⁠
You were meant to grow. ⁠
⁠

“We teach girls shame: Close your legs; cover yourself. We make them feel as though by being born female, they’re already guilty of something. As so, girls grow up to be women who cannot say they have desire. They grow up to be women who have to silence themselves.⁠
@chimamanda_adichie 
⁠
“I would rather be whole than good.” 
Carl Jung

It is inked, lines & loops of my own handwriting, curving along the path of my lower left rib. Words given to me by her, space claimed that day. 
⁠
Some days crystalize truths in ways that other days cannot. I made bargains that day. The same bargains I have spent a lifetime making.
⁠
“I am only good if I do not...”
“As long as I don’t allow this, I am not bad.”
⁠
Year after year, lover after lover, life after life. ⁠
⁠
An endless string of covenants with the universe, my body,  god, with the people I allowed entrance. 

“As long as I do not...I will still be good”
⁠
Good. Good. Good. Good. That was what mattered—the unattainable goal. ⁠
⁠
My body could not be trusted. It wanted what it wanted, bargains be damned. I took what it wanted, in the end. This made me, my body, my skin a place to distrust. A source of hurt & pain & betrayal. But still, I was relentless, searching everywhere for a promise that I could keep.

Until that day. When my skin—my rib, my thigh, the hollow of my throat—sung with so much holiness that it was suddenly clear. There was no bargain to be made between whole & good. They were the same. had always been the same.⁠
⁠
This is what I want, what my body wants. It is sacred & holy & good. 

A week later I am in a tattoo shop, curled on my side, my body remembering the deep breathing of labor, as this lesson is branded into my skin. For years, my bargains have left invisible scars, now I bring them right to the surface.  From far away, I am told, the words look like stitches, like a wound sewn shut from the outside. 
⁠
This feels appropriate, what are tattoos, really, but scars of our own choosing?⁠ What are scars, really, but our body's way of naming what we have survived?
⁠
----⁠

One morning last week I ate a grapefruit picked from a tree in my own backyard. Because I am me, this experience lodged in my brain & wouldn’t let go. 

I’ve been doing a lot of thinking about blessings lately. Navigated some tricky conversations around the intersections of luck & privilege. Sat face to face with the space where the god-damn-holy-sweet-jesus-gratitude in me meets with the woe-is-me-it’s-my-party-&-I’ll-cry-if-wanna whiner & starts a bar brawl to see who got it right. 

Now, I can tell you for sure that I like my talk of blessings the way I like my grapefruit. More sharp bite than sugary sweet. I’ll take my gratitude raw & real, with a side of holy howl, please & thank you. 

Still, even with my practice of working to stay with the goodness, I’ve come to know that we humans often get pretty supply & demand on the concept of blessings. We focus our most vocal praise-hallelujah-thanks-be-to-the-powers-above  on the hardest-to-get, the most impossible to hold.

It’s the new & novel that grabs our attention, spins us around & says “look at how wondrous I am”. But I’ve got some trees in my backyard drooping with hundreds of grapefruit that begged me to consider things differently. 

The measure of what we name miracle, I think now, simply lies in its relative inaccessibility, in the way we tend to grasp for that which we deem rare while bypassing the riches right in front of our eyes. 

The true wonder, it seems, is how often we fail to name magic or miracle that which is easily within reach.

My god. I think, when it comes down to it, it’s all pretty damn miraculous. The odds of us waking up in the morning & making it home at night. Having the exact right best friend to hold us when we cry. The first kiss, and the 500th. Witnessing that one perfect sunset. Writing the exact right line. Doing work we love that fills us up. Eating a grapefruit grown in one’s very one back yard. 

Luck. 
Magic. 
Blessing. 
Miracle.

Every last one.

This week at an event for @thereclamation bar, I read a piece that begins:

“We are all, at the heart of it, selfish assholes, & we are all, at the heart of it, good & decent people.”

I wrote this long ago, an avalanche of words spilled in search of redemption for the worst of my own breaks with integrity. To take ownership for the harm & havoc wrought as I fumbled through the fuckery. To reclaim the possibility of redemption.

I had done bad, terrible, hurtful things. Told devastating lies. Chosen myself at the price of another. But I knew myself to be good. Was desperate to believe myself patient, kind, worthy of trust. To make peace with the villain & hero living side by side in me.

Dearheart, you’ve got villain & hero in you too.

You’ve felt the forces of darkness & light waging war for the territory of your soul. Tried to tame or deny the shadows, done penance for collateral damage of your own making. Yearned for absolution for the destruction created the name of your becoming. 

You’ve scratched tally marks into the chambers of your heart, measuring good versus bad. Waging saint against sinner. Reliving every misstep, misspoken word, missed opportunity to do it better.

Yes. You can self-flagellate with the best of ‘em.

But darling, let me tell you, there is no version of this existence in which we do not hurt each other. 

I don’t say this to give you an easy out, can’t point you in the direction of your necessary amends, can’t make any of it right, not for you or for myself. The path back to integrity is one we clear on our own.

But I’ll tell you this. We all have boulders & landmines on the route, but if you’re grappling with the villain in you, you’re already committed to clearing the way.

Dearheart, it’s true that there is no version of this existence where we do not hurt each other. But it’s also true that there is no version of this existence in which we are not fundamentally responsible for healing each other too. 

It has to be so, there is no other way.

We might have to clear the path by ourselves. But that doesn’t mean we’ve gotta go it alone.

We are all just saints & sinners, villains & heroes, walking each other home*.

* @babaramdass

Permission granted to be needy af. ⁠
⁠
We're born that way: helpless, squalling balls of endless hunger and want. We're not so different as grownups —we've just been conditioned to accept that we should be.⁠
⁠
Be independent, self-sufficient, walls up, guard on, reign in your desires, take care of business, never let 'em see you want. You know the drill, you’ve got this. ⁠
⁠
We're all walking around, simmering bundles of hopes & dreams. Yearning bodies & tender hearts twisted inside out just hoping to be met somewhere in the extension yet terrified to make the reach. Sometimes we bubble up and over, all hot and bothered. So full of graceless hunger that it burns us from the inside out. ⁠
⁠
What if we destigmatize the unavoidable truth of our innate neediness? Took the sting out & leaned all the way into what is brave & fierce & hopeful & holy about the truth of that unending fire in us that pulls us forward—toward love or adventure or connection or sex or a god damn hug on a hard day or whatever dream that just won’t let go. ⁠
⁠
We aren’t meant to go it alone, to deny the way we were born wanting. We were not intended to hold the endless pulse of all this yearning inside the container of our bodies. ⁠
⁠
This life was meant for coming together. For helping hands and arms wrapped tightly around & the regulation of synchronized breath & the way it all gets easier when we are not the only ones feeling or seeking or doing a thing. ⁠
⁠
Permission granted to know & name your needs. To seek out the spaces & places & people who lean all the way in to meet you. To open your arms & heart & finally be filled. ⁠
⁠
---⁠

Let’s be real:⁠
This whole damn EXPERIENCE of LIVING is just one big 'ole TRUSTFALL.⁠
⁠
The tentative extension of hearts and bodies and wounding and hope, leaning into the possibility of crushing/wanting/loving/needing one more time, even after every attempt thus far has met with some sort of end. ⁠
⁠
//Trustfall//⁠
⁠
Throwing your entire being into the work of your heart and soul and holding it with outstretched hands, hoping someone out there in the wild ethers will see it and say yes, this is everything I have been searching for. Thank god, you made this. It—and you—are worthy. ⁠
⁠
//Trustfall//⁠
⁠
Just waking up and taking a breath and surrendering to the fact that this life may hold you for another day and it also might not. This might be it, the last day you ever get to do and say and experience it all. And so you get up and do it, despite everything that makes you want to pull the covers over your head and hide.⁠
⁠
//Trustfall//⁠
⁠
My god. we are wild and desperate and BRAVE AS FUCK. And my god, I love this for us. Against all odds foolish dreamers.Valiant hearts.⁠
⁠
Burning wild with godd//ess fire. ⁠
Making the leap ⁠
and trusting, somehow, ⁠
that the ground ⁠
will be steady enough ⁠
to hold ⁠
us all. ⁠
⁠
----⁠

questions to ask yourself when life knocks you on your ass.

When it comes to the relational shit (loss, rejection, unexpected endings) that take us by surprise / hurt like hell / bring the trigger ready to take down all in our path, we must be willing to ask ourselves a few things...

1.
What part of my response arises from my fierce & tender heart letting go of a story I desperately wanted to hold?

2.
What part of my response originates in my delicate & prickly ego & the particularly ouchy experience of untangling the delusion of my own exceptionalism?

3.
What part of my response is grief masquerading as anger directed inward because I was willing to lie to myself about what was real?

TO THE HURTING HEART,
offer care, trust, the gentle loving of the very kindest souls, the proven balm of time & space, & copious amounts of ice cream.

TO THE BATTERED EGO.
Buy a new outfit that makes you feel fabulous, gather your besties, go dancing in a crowded club. Take a moment—look yourself dead in the eye in that dirty mirror, deliver tough love honest reflection, halt the projections, & get down with what is real.

TO THE RIGHTEOUS GRIEF MASQUERADING AS ANGER.
Offer a firm reminder that though you may have been willing to live in the lie for a time, you are now existing firmly in the richness of truth.

You’re hurt because you tried so hard to make something work & it didn't. You cared enough to place your heart in the arena, gave a damn about something. Your ego is wounded because it’s crazy hard to take an honest look at the ways we perpetuate our own wounding, but god damn if you aren’t brave enough to do really hard things anyway. You’re angry because it took you longer than you think it should have to move on. Your friends knew & the books knew & maybe you even knew for a long time before you did the thing. Fuck if it doesn’t suck to take a look at that.

but, you did it love.

YOU GOT OUT
walked away
made the leap
chose yourself

OF ALL THE THINGS YOU KNOW
right now
THAT’S THE ONE
YOU MUST NOT FORGET.

THE ONE THING
YOU HOLD CLOSE.

this is the truth that will carry you back home.

￼⁠
In the notes app on my phone I have a rotating list of getting to know you questions, compiled over my many stints on Tinder, Bumble, Hinge et al. ⁠
⁠
From the lighthearted: 
Name the movie you can quote verbatim. 

To the practical: 
What’s the sure way to your heart/mind/body?

To the profoundly important multiple choice: 
This is how I feel about glitter: 
A. Pure magic in colorful crystallized form 
B. WHAT A FUCKING MESS!!! 
C. Why does everything fun have to be bad for the planet?
⁠
These questions are an easy way to start conversations in a space where good conversation can be excrutiatingly hard to find. ⁠
⁠
But there is one curveball question I’ve tucked into the mix.⁠
	#8.	What’s your guilty pleasure?⁠
⁠
This is, of course, a set up. On the list simply so I have the chance to respond “I no longer believe in feeling guilty about pleasure”.⁠
⁠
Yes, I get to look clever, and my match gets an idea of how I operate. But the way someone responds also tells me much about their relationship to their bodies, their joy, their experience of claiming their wants in the world. ⁠
⁠
What gives you pleasure and how do you feel about it? ⁠
What are you mildly embarrased to admit you enjoy?⁠
What do you deny, repress, hold in secret shame?⁠
⁠
From here, if someone is willing, the conversation can crack wide open. To sex and desire and kink, yes. But just to pure, unadulterated joy. ⁠
⁠
Do you know, in all my years copy-pasting this list of questions to more humans than I can count, only one person has ever responded with an answer that mirrors my own. ⁠
⁠
“I never feel guilty for feeling pleasure” they said.*⁠
⁠
Finally, my heart/body/being cracked open. Finally, we are getting somewhere. Finally, the beginning of something expansive and wide open. ⁠
⁠
Everytime I ask this question it feels like a form of quietly subversive activism, to sneakily suggest another way. ⁠
⁠
⁠You were NEVER meant to feel guilty about pleasure. ⁠
⁠
drop the lies. ⁠
reject the shame. ⁠
remember just how good you can feel when nobody (includng yourself) is trying to talk you out of it.⁠
⁠
📷️ @winonagrey⁠
Guilty Pleasure Print 🔗 in bio⁠

You can love him and love her and love them both. ⁠
⁠
In past and present and some imaginary future, and not need to take on any of the labels the world pushes on you for doing so. Your love doesn’t require you to fit inside a box of anyone’s design.⁠
⁠
But if you want those labels, if they fit like your favorite jeans and you bloom inside of them and somehow expand inside of you into something that feels like home and wholeness and belonging, then you can grab them and paint them large on a marquee and add lights so that everyone can see all the ways you have chosen to name yourself. ⁠
⁠
Remember, no matter what they want to call you, the words only mean anything if you decide that they do. The words you use to define yourself and claim a space for yourself in the world are yours alone to claim. ⁠
⁠

You cannot predict the future, or force life, relationship, or circumstance into a box of false safety marked by the refusal to change or accept what is true, but you CAN ground deep into what you want.

And you can remember what you've deep down known since the beginning:
Your desire has ALWAYS been the path that will lead you home.

How can I be so sure?

Isn’t being led by desire dangerous? Selfish? Wildly irresponsible?

Couldn’t it turn you into the cautionary tale from a biblical parable?

Only if we view that desire as forbidden. 

Only if we feel it tainted with shame, impossibility, and the weight of years of external judgment. 

Knowing and naming your desire is not code for rushing headlong into the wilderness. 

Acknowledging and making space for want does not mean that all responsibility or practicality or good sense vanishes in a poof of smoke. 

It does not mean that you transform into a careless or irresponsible or rashly insensitive person.

It simply means you no longer cram your head into the sands of denial. 

It simply means you shift into understanding that what you yearn your being toward has meaning, and that meaning is worthy of conscious examination, of tender acceptance, of gentle care. 

It simply means you claim the validity of that which sings you its siren song. That you are willing to hold it to the light. Twist and turn and examine it from all angles. Ask it why it lives and breaths in you, and listen for the answer. 

The drive toward action is not the point. The sweet and inarguable wisdom of wanting can be found inside the stillness of acceptance. The peace of surrender. The pivotal grace of raw honesty. 

The thing that you want? It’s not the destination. It’s not the x-marks the spot endpoint, the be-all-and-end-all, or a reason to burn it all down to satiate a momentary desire. 

It is simply the map. A wayfinder for the route on this section of your journey. A compass helping orient you to your own north star. 

Name your wants. 
Speak them out loud. 
Grant yourself the spaciousness to rest inside of what is true. Trust in the wisdom of what comes next. 
--

Some relational conflicts are rooted in the BIG BAD SHIT. Unkindness. Lack of Integrity. Ruthless indifference. 

When the big shit bubbles to the surface it can make the whole house uninhabitable real damn quick.

But many more conflicts arise because we—vastly different humans with vastly different experiences (not-so-surprisingly) say the same words but don’t mean the same thing.

We hit a sticking point & dive in. Bring our most measured, healed, level-headed communicator to the bargaining table. Grapple, debate, seek truth. 

Finally, we imagine we are on the same page. Hearing & being heard. Solid ground. Everyone is reasonably content. We got this.

But days or weeks or months later, the bubbles hit the surface again (relational shit, so very inconveniently bubbly, no?). To our surprise/chagrin/anger/hurt we realize we weren’t having the same conversation. At all. 

Two humans can sit at the same table for years without ever once truly sharing a meal.

Differences in semantics. Discrepancies in how we define certain words. Significant contrast in how we create meaning. Metaphors don’t land as we assumed. Examples translate in a way we never predicted. 

Agreements that felt cohesive, well communicated & entered into with integrity integrated in your being way differently than they did in your partner/bestie/child/parent. 

You’re back at square one. Confused / betrayed / tumbled around & upside down, not sure which way is up or out. Questioning the whole damn thing.

Sweet Jesus fuck—I’ve said it before & I’ll say it again—this being human & alive & in relationship is hard. 

I have come to understand—with a newly crystalized awareness— how often conflict is not necessarily rooted in a lack of compatibility or intentional wrongdoing. 

The trouble rests on our overconfident assumption that we understand what’s been said. Our lack of curiosity & disinclination to go deeper. Our failure to ask more questions and listen without filtering the answers through our own biased understanding. 

Ask better questions. Get naked. Listen harder. Dig below the surface of the words. Open the dictionary of your soul. Become a skilled translator of the ones you love.

Instructions for those who wish to know the whole of me:​​​​​​​​​
1. Be less directed by the power of your desire to make contact with my skin, and more guided by the specific desire of my flesh for your connection. 

2. Do not touch me when you want to touch me, lay your hands on me only when my body lets you know it is no longer willing to remain untouched. 

3. Do not pace yourself by the measure of your own craving, mark your speed by learning to read the energy of my want, the cadence of my sigh, the pitch of my moan. 

4. Do not assume the erogenous zones of my body are limited to the ones you’ve learned up until now. The entirety of my skin is a source of certain bliss. To limit yourself to a small fraction of my being is to miss the point of my pleasure entirely.

5. Do not ask for, nor in any way expect, my surrender until it has been fully earned. When you prove yourself safe and worthy of my trust it will be offered completely and without hesitation. Rest assured, you will not have to wonder.

6. Forget what you think you know of a woman and her capacity for pleasure. The rules are about to be rewritten.

7. You must be willing to become an eager student, a tireless detective, a humble devotee. One does not become a master without effort.

8. And hear this, you'd best reach fluency before you attempt to read me aloud.

--

This Valentine’s Day, why not love yourself first?

Dearheart,

Why don’t you take every single love song that has ever been written & recast the words so they all point back to you.

Get deeply intimate with your own heart, mind, body & desire. Offer the sweetest & kindest love to yourself, first, last & always. 

Spend a little time every single day seducing yourself. Buy the expensive chocolate. Light the candles. Turn on the music that feels like desire.

Romance your own mystical soul.  Take yourself on fancy dates & find pleasure in your own company. 

Spoil yourself. Extremely well.

Experience the ways you deserve to be treated so you know how to recognize it when it is offered by someone else.

Wear the outfit that makes you feel like a god/dess & dance in the mirror alone in your room. 

Make your bed with the highest thread count sheets you can afford, so sliding into bed feels like a gift.

Touch your own skin with infinite tenderness & exploration, there are always new things to learn when it comes to the hidden secrets of your body’s path to pleasure. 

Share your body & heart & soul on your terms & your timeline & with gratitude & reverence.

Get comfortable with Saturday morning solitude & mowing your own lawn. 
Take long walks in the warm rain.

Trust yourself to know what is true for you right now, even if it is exactly the opposite of what you once believed or what you may believe tomorrow.

Your relationship with yourself? It’s the only one that will last your entire life. You are the most important partner you will ever have, here to uphold your contract with yourself above all others. 

This life? All yours. 
In the leaving & the staying. 
In the yes & the no. 
In the heat & the heart & the lonely & the grief. 
All yours, & only yours. 
You will live it exactly as you should.
You will do it with beauty & grace & a fierce sort of wisdom that will amaze even you.
And it will be perfectly, exactly right.
——

The most heartbreaking moment of any ending isn’t really the ending, I don’t think. ​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
It’s not the abject grief of the early days or the grasping denial that follows. It comes months later. When life has found new equilibrium and you’ve adjusted to what now is, and even made a tenuous sort of peace—a rational understanding—of the hows and whys and what’s of the necessity of this ending. ​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
And then, that moment comes—and it always does—when you realize that this human, the one you knew inside and out. The one on whose skin you could have mapped every tattoo and freckle and scar. The one whose taste your mouth had memorized, whose heartbeat had synced with yours in the deep of so many 3 am dreamscapes. The one with whom you fell hard and laughed harder and cried and grappled and fought and lost. ​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
That person, once as close to you as breath, is now a stranger. Living an entire life you know nothing of. With joy and grief and struggle and celebrations and motivation and a thousand ordinary moments to which you are not privy. Making choices that feel perplexing. Moving, as is appropriate, on with their lives. ​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
Becoming, with each day that passes, a being you no longer know.​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
It is in that moment, I believe, that the real letting go occurs.​​​​​​​​

Where hands and heart loosen the last of their grip, palms turn upward into the open air. Where you throw your head back to the sun, take the deepest of inhales, sending breath down into the roots of you, and you just let go. ​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
Yes, in many ways, this is the most heartbreaking moment of any goodbye. The true relinquishment of the joint story, of that knowing that once felt so entirely holy. It may be a moment that holds tender grief, yes.​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
But this is also the moment that finally sets you free. ​​​​​​​​
​​​​​​​​
--​​​​​​​​

Across my decades of writing, there have been some questions that return.

Asked by people who are unhappy, unsafe, unfulfilled. 

By humans awakening to their identities, sexualities, desires. 

By beings trapped in jobs, families, or relationships, existing as a fragment of wholeness.

By souls who have behaved, conformed & compartmentalized for so long they find themselves pulled to the dividing line between their safe life & the great unknown.

So, how do you know when it is time to go?

You leave when staying becomes an undeniable act of violence toward yourself.

When the small, quiet whisper inside of you grows to a cacophony of your own knowing. 

When your desire to be true outweighs your desire for security. 

When you are willing to know what have not wanted to know. 

When staying makes you feel as if a part of you is dying.

When you’re reading my words & you feel your heart pound in recognition. 

When regardless of the pain ahead, you know—deep in your bones—that leaving is the only thing that feels like freedom.

When you’re ready to stop choosing the devil you know in favor of the whole & holy truth of you. 

Do not dismiss the quiet acquiescence of your spirit as anything less than worthy of the words & actions of revolution. 

Violence isn’t always loud & painful. Death occurs in a million different ways. 

Sometimes it is simply a bone-deep knowing there is more out there, waiting for you to claim it. And the not claiming? It cuts you somewhere nameless in a way you know you cannot sustain. 

What could be more worth fighting a war for than the survival of your inimitable spirit?

It is no small thing to hold enough courage to be willing to break your own heart to remain in integrity with your soul. 

@cherylstrayed said, “Wanting to leave is enough”. She was right. 

It always is. 

Go wild one. 
Go where they know your true name.
Go where your body unfolds into oceans of pleasure. 
Go where your safety is the only option. 
Go where your soul sings an aria of homecoming. 

When it is time to leave, you’ll know. 

When you do, I will greet you with hot tea, & a warm bath & arms that say welcome home, love. 

I’ve been waiting for you.

Every story begins in the body.
Every story makes a home inside our skin.
Where in your wild heart do your stories live?

We are all made of stories. 

The stories that formed us in a time before we could even attempt to make meaning of our lives. The stories we chose with every last bit of our tenacious will. The stories that chose us, despite the fact that we tried to deny them a hundred times over. The stories we cling to out of loyalty or familiarity or a sense of identity in a world that leaves us grasping for belonging.

Each of these stories lives somewhere in the muscles & bones & blood of us. They each nestle somewhere in our heart, our hips, our lungs. 

Heartbreak tucks into the spaces in our ribs. Deep & flickering dreams lodge in our sacrum. Nostalgia lives in the tightness of our throat when we speak of what has been lost. 

So often, we live these stories without acknowledging them. We don’t often sit around the campfire & hold the stories of our making to be illuminated by the flames while a kind village of wise souls gathers, ready to hold the whole of us. 

We don’t do this because we live in a world that offers few opportunities for such vulnerability, & because it is easier, sometimes, to be with what is if we do not look at what has been or what may be. 

But an untold story is an impossible weight. We’re already, most of us, walking around this earth to heavy for our bones.

To tell a story is to make space. To clear room for what comes next. To set yourself free. 

During the 30 days of Wild Heart Writing we examine themes of worth & longing. Of hope & hunger. Of forgiveness & freedom. 

The questions that form the prompts are simple. But the stories that follow are deep, complex, multifaceted & profound. Every one different, because each writer is a universe unto themself. And each story is also linked to other stories, because each universe is connected by invisible threads. 

Ready to excavate the stories in your wild heart?

She will whirl into your life
Like a god damn tornado
You cannot hold yourself steady
Against the likes of her
Best let go
See where she takes you

She’s not for the ones who want things
Neat and tidy
And all figured out
Life lined up in ordered little rows.
Risk adverse? 
Keep on moving.

She leaves nothing untouched. 
Not your present or your past 
Or your mysterious somedays.
Totality is her domain.
And entirety is the only
language she speaks. 

You should know this
You’ll never own her
Possession is for a different sort
Of woman
One less hell bent on
freedom

She is sovereign onto herself
A force of her own nature
A creature of her own design
A wide-open, full-force hurricane of aliveness. 
If she submits, it will be because it feeds her
And only ever for a time. 

She’ll knock your safe little life off kilter.
In a thousand nameless ways.
Storm through the barricades. 
Smash the deadbolts on the doors.
Make quick work of the walls you’ve built for containment. 

And you?
In spite of yourself 
you’ll only want more.

"I wish I knew that I’m doing the right thing….”​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​She said this to me years ago. Should she leave her husband? Could she? Would staying be the better choice? The right one? 

There is no right thing, you know, I told her. No wrong thing, either. There is just the thing you do.

You do it. Close your eyes & leap. Try to do it the best you can. Given how fucked up-crazy-brilliant-lovely-impossible it all is; the best you can is no small thing.

All of this matters far more than the minute details of the choice. The complexities of the decision, the tricky twists & turns, the agony & ecstasy that live intertwined?  These are important—of course they are—but not as important as the doing. The doing is what will deliver you from here to there.

Of course, there are some choices that carry inherent harm. That exist outside of integrity. That are dishonest or callous or insensitive. That are motivated by hate or violence or disregard. That's not what I'm talking about here. What I'm speaking are the complexities of life. Living & loving & trying our damndest to do it all without collateral damage. To take care of ourselves & our people & our world & to never, ever misstep.

Impossible.

We're going to fuck it up. It will get messy, guaranteed. But what I believed then (and what I believe even more now) is that by living into these choices (& through them & beyond them) we actually create our lives. Not in specifics of the choices themselves, but what we make of them after the doing is done.

Every choice we make holds inherent reward & regret. How those balance out we never know, at least not until long after the fact.

But the audacity is in the living, my love, not in the choosing. Do your best. Stake your claim. Aim true. And make of it what you will. 

I have faith that it will be beautiful.

Part Two:​​​​​​​​​For the love of all that is good and holy. Remember who the fuck you are not.

YOU ARE NOT:
a mistake in need of apology, a problem in need of a solution, an accident requiring correction, a second-thought half-assed possibility, or an easily replaceable option.

YOU ARE NOT:
too much. you will never be too much, you are perfectly, exactly enough.

YOU ARE NOT:
a frail and broken thing, requiring repair to be worthy of love.

YOU ARE NOT:
required to stay who you were, or who you are, or even who you may be, you were made for metamorphosis

YOU ARE NOT:
a dusty myth to be relegated to the pages of a history book, not the product of a bygone age.

YOU ARE NOT:
a lesson frozen in time, not a one-dimensional hazard light warning sign, nor doomsday prediction.

YOU ARE NOT:
only deserving when the world is able to witness your perfection, your existence is justification enough.

YOU ARE NOT:
the story they handed you at birth, not the assigned narrative of your culture, not the mythology pressed upon you.

YOU ARE NOT:
the damsel in distress or the evil villain, not the sleeping princess awaiting rescue in some tumbledown tower in the middle of the forest.

YOU ARE NOT:
the story they made of you, you are not even the story you have made of yourself, you are not a singular story at all—you contain all the stories that have ever been, & every last one that will ever become.

Sometimes you can search for so long that you lose track of the one place that matters the most.

HOME.
It is time to go home. Home to the earth that named you. Home to the ground that flows with that which brought you to life. Home to the root, to the heat, to the core of it all. Home to yourself. This is not about home on the map. Not about where you were born or raised. Not about where anyone lives or where the good jobs are or where you’re expected to turn up eventually. Not about the lover who weaves words into the heat of desire. Not about ties that bind or anything that feels like obligation or giving up or giving in. It’s not about staying or leaving or anything in between. It may not even be about movement at all, not the way most people think of it. No. This time, you are called home to yourself. You are called to integration. To the point of intersection. To completion. To the center of the paradox and the white heat of your own knowing. You are called to a claiming of place and space and intention and desire that is all your own and only your own.

Breathe that all the way in, love, and welcome yourself all the way home.

Your life belongs to you now.

Your life and your story and your body and your intuition and your precious wild heart.
Every last bit of what makes you the extraordinary miracle that you are.

Regardless of what the rest of the world demands, here, there is no compromise. No settling. No making do.

This homecoming is reclamation. This is hallowed ground.

And it is entirely true. Your life, your heart, your wisdom, it is all your own. And what you do from here is up to you.

Because you were never like the rest of them, my dear, you were always made for more.

—-
If you’re ready to chart your course back home to the life that belongs to you - enter the wild heart writing circle on march 20th and write you way wild, free, all the way back home. 🔗 in bio.

I talk a good game. ​​​​​​​​​I pep talk-lecture-write even better. 

I don’t say a damn thing I don’t know-trust-deep-down-believe to be true. 

But I also write my way into my own life to arrive at the steady ground of my own knowing. 

This whole giving/receiving shit? Top of the list, loves.

I’ve been writing about it for years because I’ve been working on this for years. It’s hard for me. Really hard. 

The wanting part: owning my desires. Speaking them aloud. Letting the truth stand in the open air? That’s gotten a lot easier. 

The piece that requires standing awkwardly exposed in the naked truth of my longing? I’m fairly well versed in that. Willing to let you see the wholeness of my wanting soul. It’s what I do, & I do it well.

But the part of the equation that requires I allow myself to receive? Oy. 

Most of the time I’m still tightly wound around my want, as if I can create a fortress that will keep that want safe from the world.

Problem is, fortresses are not designed for welcoming - they are built for the sole purpose of keeping things (& people & love & abundance) out. 

Allowing myself to want while only allowing myself to possess if it doesn’t involve the vulnerability of inviting someone to give (& me to receive) sure does limit.

But in those slivers of space where I let down my guard. Where the safety exists. Where someone leads me strongly & steadily enough that I surrender. Where there is enough trust to believe that the offer comes from a space of integrity & honoring. 

When my body acquiesces & my heart cracks open & I speak my desire as a prayer to the universe, & someone listens & responds, hands held out in sacred offering. And when my hands open and reach back.

That's where the magic lives.
