Stay more loyal to your own life (& the living of it) than you are to the grief of what’s been left behind.

So often I have prided myself on my loyalty, on the way I stay the course, hold steady, batten down the hatches & ride out the storm.

At times, my unwillingness to release my hold (on relationship / trauma / letting go / grief /outdated contracts that no longer served) was rooted in my determination to rewrite my own mythological narrative - I was a lover of leaving, the one who breaks things.

There is no doubt I have brought harm, to myself & to those I love. Sometimes, those stories are the ones I default to telling, over & over. I’ve death grip held on to some seriously twisted tales, stubbornly loyal to places, people & relationships I have grown out of or away from. Longing & pining, reaching backward in time, 

Holding on to what was already gone, curling myself around the memory & nurturing the angst tenderly as penance for my catalog of regrets, for all the ways I have named my wrongdoings & found fault with my fumbling humanity. 

I have been far more loyal to my grief than I have been to my own life. The one in front of me in this breath & the next & the next. The one waiting for me to claim it & wholeheartedly choose what is most alive. My loyalty came at the expense of leaning forward into presence, possibility & sustainable joy. ⠀

Fidelity is a beautiful thing. But the devotion that matters most— the contract & commitment that has the power to change everything—is the fierce, unyielding loyalty to this moment, to my own heart, to the joy that begs me to move toward it.⠀

Be loyal, my loves. Yes. 

Live a life of fierce devotion. 

But root that loyalty in the center of your own heart, in the deep presence you bring to your singular life, & the only true contract you will ever have, the one you hold with yourself. ⠀

Your grief is real, & your regret, & loss & desire to make right the wrongs. But to offer your loyalty there at the expense of the here & now is a disservice to your life. To the joy & the love that is waiting for you. 

Land fully in the center of your own living, my dear. 
Your grief doesn’t need your loyalty. 
YOU do.

Dearheart,⁠
⁠
You know what?⁠
You and me—we've got this.⁠
⁠
Even on the days when we think we absolutely don’t. We totally do.⁠
⁠
most of the time I know we both feel like we are fucking up more than we are holding on. But of the few things I'm dead sure of in this crazy world, I'm really damn sure of this.⁠
⁠
Wanna know how I know?⁠
⁠
I know we've got this Because somehow we are still here. Walking through the world. Standing tall. Speaking loudly. Residing in truth. Owning power. Raising boundaries. Claiming space. Letting ourselves crumble. Centering in self. learning to trust. Making art. healing our wounds. Opening our arms. Making waves. Dancing in the eye of the storm. owning our parts. Loving well. Naming our own pleasure holy. Singing loudly with the windows down. Open to receiving. Giving hard core. Inviting the muse to dance. Returning home to the center of our own knowing.⁠
⁠
After all the clusterfuckery we’ve come through to get to this exact moment, how can we fail to stop and say:⁠
“Fuck yes, self. You are one hell of a rock star, one holy fuck of a truly badass bitch, and an epic warrior god/dess”⁠
⁠
How can we sing anything but a praise song of unending thank you, over and over, to the badassery of our complex, fumbling, tenacious human selves?⁠
⁠
How can we not worship the hard lines and soft curves of these bodies that hold our souls and carry us through the world and ache and want and know?⁠
⁠
How can we name ourselves anything but a goddamn miracle?⁠
⁠
So yes, beyond a shadow of a doubt, we've got this.⁠
⁠
Keep giving ‘em hell, darling.⁠
Keep loving harder. Keep feeling deeper. Keeping believing in magic. Keep laying it all on the line for love. Keeping showing up and throwing down and letting the pieces fall and picking them all up again to build something even better than you imagined possible.⁠
⁠
Keep doing this life the way only you can.⁠
⁠
Brilliantly Beautiful. Resiliently Brave. Wildly True.⁠
⁠
Xo. JLB.⁠
⁠

I am a damn good writer. A word witch who weaves spells from language & casts worlds out of words, easy as breath. I build a life & make a living on a foundation of story, writing is the house & home of me.

This is beautiful for my work, more tangled for the reality of living. For one so well-versed in the act of conjuring narrative, crafting it into saga or parable to teach, empower & inspire, it’s all too easy to slip into the habit of imagining one can do the same with life. 

Like Dr. Strange pulling the electric threads of time out of thin air, I fancy myself capable of welding magical control over unbendable reality of the stories I am living. I presume I can alter the plot, character development & story arc, like a puppet master pulling strings, determined to grasp for the slightest chance of impacting the outcome, choosing to see what I prefer rather than what is real. 

How very grandiose of me.

I’ve stubbornly ignored the plot holes, foreshadowing & voice over narration. If it doesn’t match with the story I want I turn a blind eye to the truth written right in front of my face. 

(Picture the ingenue in a horror film, walking straight into the arms of the waiting killer, while the audience screams NOOOOOO, YOU DUMB FUCK, YOU DON’T EVER GO BACK INTO THE BASEMENT!). 

In hindsight it’s been that obvious. We can be such stubborn instigators of our own undoing, such foolhardy heralders of our own doom. But only because we hope & dream. We want to believe, in spite of it all. I’ve got to give us a whole lot of compassion for that. 

I’m trying things a different way this time around. Slower pacing. Wild discernment. Holy boundaries. Not naming or labeling or forcing. I’m interrogating the story I attempt to tell, while also giving it space to grow enough voice to tell itself. I am learning to rest in what is real. 

As a writer, and as a human, this is holy work.

—
Ready to write what is real? Join me for Wild Heart Writing. Link in bio.

This is for the women.

Not just the cis-het women. 

The queer women. Trans women. Femmes, butches & mascs. Queens & kings & every woman who eschews available labels as too limited to contain the whole of them. The wayfinders who chart a new course & redefine what is possible. For those—as @andreagibson said —whose pronouns have not been invented yet, who dismantle the dictionary & help us construct a lexicon big enough to hold the entirety of what is possible. 

For those born women who fought or are fighting their way into other identities, bodies or ways of being. For those women born into other identities or bodies or ways of being who found that woman was the key that finally opened the locked door to their own understanding. For the non binary souls who exist somewhere in the intoxicating liminality of the undefinable ethers & those who embrace the fluidity to be woman when woman is a name fits that right inside their skin, & on the days when it proves an unwelcoming home, to leave it aside & embrace something different. 

For women who wake up knowing that to be woman is to be born into battle, for rights or voices or wombs (& by this, of course, I mean all women). For  women who know violence because of gender or presentation or sexuality. For those harmed or maimed or killed in the process of claiming their sovereign birthright or for the simple reality of being born girl or claiming woman as their own. For the black women & the brown women & the indigenous women & the women of every shade this earth has ever painted. For the mothers & the daughters & the sisters & the aunts & the ancestors, & for those who claim family in ways that have nothing to do with naming their bloodline. For the witches & the brujas & the warriors & the martyrs. For the the innocence of the maidens & the nurturing of the mothers & the wisdom of the crones. 

For every woman I have named here, & for all that remain unnamed. I honor you. 

#internationalwomansday

I have covid. 

It’s been a doozy & I’ve barely left my bed. I’ve been well cared for by those who love me. Deliveries of tests meds & immune boosters. Books to read, soup & smoothies & chocolate cupcakes to eat. 

Getting out of bed quickly reminds me that I need to return. The fog of covid-brain makes even binging TV a challenge. But allowing myself to really & truly rest? Putting down the ever present stress that says to not show up, be visible, keep the constant push means that it will all fall apart…it’s not easy.

Confession: I OFTEN BELIEVE THAT IF I DON’T KEEP PUSHING, KEEP MY GUARD UP, KEEP BEND-BEND-BENDING INTO THE BREAK, THAT IT WILL *ALL* FALL APART.

On top of the soup & the smoothies & cupcakes, the prescription this week (probably always) is actually grace. 

Grace because I cannot do it all.
Grace because my body is just a body, fallible & in need of care. 
Grace that the work can somehow wait & the world will continue to spin if I step away for a few days. 
Grace that I am worthy of care (& caretaking), receiving, safety, respite & ease. 
Grace that somehow it will all work out. 

I don’t have it all worked out. I’m graceless as often as I am graceful. But I know that I am not much good at extending tenderness into the world unless I get real damn good at receiving it when offered & extending it to myself. 

So here I am in bed, throat on fire, woozy as fuck, losing hours to TikTok, holding onto every ounce of grace that I can. 

Where does your life need more grace today?
What does that grace look & feel like?
Where would it land in your body?
How can you give it to yourself, & how can you open yourself to receiving it from others?

One way I know for sure that exists as a true path to expanding grace is to exist in the truth of our stories. I am calling in the wild heart writing circle once again this month. To learn more about how you can unfold into the grace that exists inside your story, learn more at the link in my bio.

I know a thing or two about hearts. ⁠
⁠
I know they are brave, strong & resilient. Capable of holding back a tsunami of pain just to keep on keeping on. ⁠
⁠
But I also now they are delicate, tender, & far more fragile than we admit.⁠
⁠
With every extension, we cross our fingers, knock wood, lift our eyes & pray. ⁠
⁠
“Let this one be more gentle, more kind. Softer & more whole. Let it last long enough to catch my exhale. Let me be met & held inside of every unmet dream. Please, this time, be worthy of all this stored-up hope”. ⁠
⁠
We close our eyes, hold our breath, spread our wings & ⁠fall. 
⁠
We are made for the fall. But these hearts also need to be caught & held. Cherished, worshiped, & named holy.⁠ In word & in action. Consistently. Predictably. Wholly.⁠
⁠
So often the extension on which we pinned our hearts does not end gracefully, or delicately, or with the degree of care we know we deeply deserve. ⁠
⁠
Not because we extend in the direction of known harm, or willingly walk toward obliteration. Not because we were stupid, foolish, or asking to be hurt.⁠
⁠
Because we really, truly want to believe.⁠
⁠
Look at us all fumbling around, so many walking wounded. Live through enough heartache & it all starts to look like the emotional metaphor for some dystopian movie set. 

Most of us are patched together more times than we can count—a kaleidoscope of delusion & faith, duct tape & glitter glue—reckless & wrecked & still somehow steering ourselves in the direction of every possible redemption.⁠
⁠
My god, we need to be kinder to each other’s war-torn hearts. We need to be more gentle, to offer more care, more patience, more calm & steady safety, trust & protection. We need to require more of ourselves. We’ve all hurt more than enough.⁠
⁠
More than that, we need to be so much braver with our own. Brave enough to say no. To hold the line. To walk away when we are not met. To know the worth we carry in our bones. To be willing to hurt in order to keep our hearts safe. To hold ourselves as the holiest relationship we will ever know. ⁠
⁠
Be kind to each other loves. But be so very brave with yourselves. This, after all, is the only heart you’ve got.⁠

You deserve to feel all the way good.

Why is this one so hard?⁠
⁠
Why is this one so scary?⁠
⁠
Why are we all so terrified to sink into the beauty and bliss and pleasure and wonder and joy of it all?⁠
⁠
Who convinced us that to let the goodness all the way in (to our heart, our bones, our bodies, our all) was to place it all at risk?⁠
⁠
What if they were wrong all along?⁠
⁠
What if holding the good to the light and proclaiming it a miracle is the only real way we get to experience it all?⁠
⁠
What if there's no way to make anything last anyway so keeping quiet in an attempt to stay safe is just a fools game?⁠
⁠
What if our attempt to not call attention to the things that make us feel all the way alive is the very thing that limits us from the depth of their promise?⁠
⁠
What if we started trusting that we are worthy, that this is why we are here, that the universe is continually bending toward possibility and pleasure?⁠
⁠
What if we gave ourselves permission to feel all the way good?⁠
⁠
What might be possible then?

Often in this life, I’ve wished for a harder heart. 

A rougher edge. 
A tougher exterior. 
Some badass alter ego who could step in as my proxy and handle the tough shit without missing a beat.

As if I ever had a hope of being a human with fewer fucks to give. 

(Background: I am a giver of a massive amount of fucks. A veritable boatload of fucks given. A hardcore plethora of every last little fuck you can imagine. Ambivalent, I am most certainly not). 

But I don’t need (or even want) a harder heart. 

You see, I well know that my deep wells of compassion and near-infinite stores of forgiveness are priceless gifts.  
My capacity for showing up to love is damn near legendary. 
My arms are better served embracing all that hurts than holding the world at bay. 

I want an open door and a crowded table where all us brilliant fuck-ups can break bread and break down together. Where we close each night with a hymn that is part prayer and part battle cry, naming our personal and collective healing the most worthy of all revolutions. 

Ain’t no way to create a life like that with a hardened heart.

But what I do need, and have had to work damn hard to cultivate to make that dream a reality, are stronger boundaries. 

Not boundaries like walls, mind you. 
Not boundaries like some barbed wire electrified fence around the perimeter of all I deem worthy. 
Not boundaries like a shock collar that goes off every time I feel the gentle pull of my own generosity or empathy or magnanimity. 
Not boundaries like the rapid fire of some semi-automatic weapon designed for destruction. 
Not boundaries like “my way or the highway”, “because I said so” or “talk to the hand”. 
Not boundaries like the imaginary but immovable border between two countries who learned to fight early because they were told that was the only thing to do. 

Boundaries (as the queen herself @randi.buckley taught me) that function like an instruction manual, allowing the humans I love a way to access the very best of me.

Survival isn’t just a matter of your heart pumping blood (that’s the easy bit). ​​​​​​​​​True survival is measured by the potential that exists for the fullness of your living. 
How alive do you feel?
How aware are you right now of the pulse of your heart, soul, and spirit?
What can you do to lean into the fierce truth of your own aliveness?
How can you move just a tiny bit closer to that which brings you to blazing, undeniable life?

Do that.

question orders. contradict authority. hold your contract with yourself above all others. speak your truth. stand your ground. go where they say you cannot go. do what they say must not be done. get off the beaten path. blaze your own trail. take the road less traveled. be honey and knife blade. be whiskey burn and lightning strike. be woodsmoke and ocean current. be whatever the fuck you want. if you need to leave, do not look back. claim your true name. embrace the paradox. make your own rules just so you can break them all. fuck that safety shit. color outside the lines. learn to hear to the pounding beat of your own heart above all the noise. throw open the doors. say hell yes. loudly. show up. full force. burn some shit down if you need to make space for new things to be born. you were born of fire, my dear. you are made of the light of a thousand distant suns. plant seeds born of your own rebellion. darling, every crack you named breakdown was always a breakthrough. you've always been the boss of you. you've owned every space you've ever walked into. so, by all means, enter.

I once had a good friend who called me Grace.  Yes, it was used ironically. ​​​​​​​​​
I've always been a little bit more accident-prone than most. Head in the clouds, not quite of this realm, always a little outside of my physical body. 

I'm usually walking around with bruises without being able to remember impact points. I regularly blister with burns caused wholly by inattention. And yes, I have often found myself tripping over thin air. 

No doubt, my heart has gotten banged up as much as my body. Some of that? Just a side effect of living. None of us gets out clean, after all. But some of the ache? For sure a product of the way my wide-open hope has acted like blinders, preventing me from seeing the obstacles that were always in the way. 

I used to beat myself up about this (hell, I used to beat myself up about a whole hell of a lot and I'm still working on laying down those weapons) until I one day realized that all I was doing was shaming myself for the super complex crime of moving through this world as me:

Ridiculously clumsy. Wildly optimistic about humanity. Not overly cautious. Brave as fuck. Open-hearted. Forever distracted by beauty. Here not to keep myself safe, but most certainly to learn how to heal. 

If you are like me, my love, perhaps you never needed protection. You just need a safe room where nobody (including and most importantly yourself) blames you for all the broken things. You needed salve for the burns. Enough glue to patch back together what was meant to be saved. And enough good sense to help you release what was never meant for salvage. 

Perhaps, instead, you were born with the power to heal. You never needed to be more careful.  You just needed a foundation strong enough to hold steady when the breaking began. Wisdom enough to triage your own wounds. And a safe home to return to when the battles were done.

Self-love is an act of holy disruption: ​​​​​​​​​

To love yourself in a world that profits directly from your self-loathing is the ultimate subversion of all that seeks to keep you tame. 

We've been taught to hate all that we are (our softness, our fierceness, our not-enoughness, our too-muchness, our tender flesh, our hard bones, our voices, our insatiable hunger, our yearning for more, our aging, our youth, our ugly, our beauty, our all) so that we can be packaged into a commodity that sells us back to ourselves.

Our self-hatred is, in many ways, one of the pillars that capitalism and the patriarchy rely on to keep us small and contained, caged and corralled, safe and quietly in place.
To fall headfirst into a lifelong love affair with our purpose, our passion, our capacity, for pleasure, with the sound of our yes and the tenor of our no. With the reflection in the mirror. With the rich inner landscape of our fumbling and messy aliveness—this threatens the status quo. 

As Naomi Wolf said, "Our appetites DO need to be controlled if things are to stay in place."

I don't know about you, but I'm at all not interested or invested in keeping things in place, in maintaining the status quo, in propping up a paradigm that's been trembling on its last legs for far too long. 

I don't want to have to tamp down my desire, to contain the embers of my fire, to minimize the heat of my burn. I want to love myself enough to always ask for more, and then I want to love myself harder so that I can expand wide enough to receive it when it comes. And no, I don’t think this is easy. Or simple. Or even always gentle. 

But you loving you?
Really, really loving yourself?
It subverts the whole damn thing. 
It disrupts the narrative.
It flips the script. 
It’s a way to reclaim all that has been taken. 
To demand your seat at the table.
To call your wholeness home.

Dear reluctant creatives, inhibited artists, dancers hiding in dark and secret corners, & wanna-be writers holding entire worlds just waiting to be born.

You’ve got canvas & paint stacked in the closet & an entire novel bursting at the seams of your soul. You burn with the need to make things, but still—somehow do not.

Your doubt speaks loud and clear, but not loud enough to drown out the insistent call of your muse. You’ve something to say but the power of that message makes you want to shrink and hide.

What could happen if you unleashed? 
What would change? 
What would you lose? 
What would they say? 
Who would you be?

You can’t answer those questions, so you don’t do the thing. You resist & avoid. You get caught in the loop of perpetual busyness &debilitating self-doubt. Random priorities push your call to create to the bottom of the pile.

You ignore the calling. Negate your gift. Aim for perfection & fall short. You speak unkind words directed only at yourself. You try to content yourself with everything but that wholly terrifying thing you know you are meant to do.

That thing you are avoiding with all you have? It is your purpose. Your passion. Your art.

Enough, darling. Enough with the excuses, the fear, & all that wild & unruly resistance, enough with all the voices that say you cannot or should not or must not answer this call. Enough with every last obstacle in the way of you doing what you are here to do.

You are here to create.
It’s time to show up.

(read the rest of the reluctant artist manifesto on substack—printable graphics + a full essay graphic free to all paid subscribers).

I feel wild tender about this moon. 

Perhaps it is that it rises in the sign of Libra, my sun. Or because we are solidly in Aries season, my opposition on the zodiac, my polarity in life. I have been exploring lately what it is to lean into equal but opposite, the stark reality of mirrored images in unceasing relief. 

Such polarity illuminates & enlightens & feels like the most raw & unrestrained pleasure. It catches on hastily covered sharp edges, exposes what was tucked into shadows & holds it exposed for all to see. It is turn-on & craving & antagonism & primal-animalistic-tender-please-please-hold-me. “Here is where you still hurt”, the polarity says. “But here, also, is where you heal. Which path will you choose? How will you walk it? Where exactly do you wish to go?”

Seeing ourselves that clearly… it can be almost unbearable, & it can be sweet, holy, true. 

Or maybe it is because when I step into my backyard now my entire being is filled with the scent of citrus. Because I live in the desert I can still pick this year’s bounty from my trees even while next year’s is being born. 

On the same tree, some fruit has gone to rot but I pluck an almost too ripe orange from one branch while bees flit from blossom to blossom, whispering, “here will grow something miraculous & new”. 

It makes me think of the way we are always living life in the now while also somehow growing what will be, staggering past-present-future & holding it all with our fumbling humanness. 

Maybe it is simply because I am standing, on the night of this full moon, on the precipice of new understanding. Of new discernment. Asking brand new questions & pausing long enough to hear what might be the answers. 

Being brave enough to try them on for size without promising anything to anyone. I am stumbling through learning to trust myself again, the most tender devotion of all. I am not sure at all, not in the slightest, if I can do any of this right. But I am doing it. Just like you. 

May the balance of Libra & the spark of Aries steady & guide you through the dark. May the moon shine her light on your steady face. May you lift your arms to the sky & know that you are witnessed, seen, loved

What is asking to be created, right now?

This is the very first question of Wild Heart Writing Round 2 (which just began).

It is, in fact, the very first question of every round of Wild Heart Writing & a question I return to in my personal practice.

Just when you think you've figured it out, art shifts, changes, evolves. Whatever you thought you were sure of magic-spell-morphs & becomes something entirely new.

That's why we have to keep asking the same questions over & over. Not to be redundant or repetitive, but because if we dive deep enough into the question we will almost always arrive at a different answer.

So, what is asking to be created, if your life, right now?

�What stories want to be told?

�What secrets spilled?

�What contracts are ready to be made or broken?

�What skills wish to be learned?

�What spells are rising up, waiting to be cast?

�What wants to be made, written, shared, painted, danced, spoken, sculpted, incanted, conjured from the ethers, seduced from the muse?

What embers are burning inside you, letting you know they are ready to be molded by mystery & alchemy into something new?

In writing, & in all of life, I am a die-hard believer in following the path of aliveness.

When a particular iteration of our art is no longer alive, we must become relentless seekers of what is ready to be born, & we must midwife it into creation.
Living art is the only sort of art I have any interest in making.

I invite you to sit & answer this question for yourself right now. Set a timer for 10 minutes & unleash the creative force that lives in your belly. Don't worry about being sensible or limited by reality.

Write until the spark of aliveness turns into an ember & the ember can be fanned into a flame.

PS: If you're interested in answering questions like this in the circle of Wild Heart Writers, 30 more of these prompts will be sent out every day over the next month, each one designed to help you turn the compass of your own wild heart back to the direction of your aliveness. Yes, darlings, I’ve been quiet. 

No. I’m not going to say a lot quite yet. Some periods are for the sort of living that is done underground & behind closed doors, tucked in the shadows. Private & protective & enclosed. Even when the basis of one's art is one's life, not everything is meant to be shared & consumed. 

These weeks have delivered some deep teachings. About the lure of stability & the tenuous nature of regulation. About holy discernment & hard lines & soft places to fall. Reminders that trauma is a deeply unreliable narrator & makes for a lousy character witness. Moments of fear, & exhaustion, & unavoidable reckoning with the fact that we don’t know what we know until we are finally ready to know it. An opportunity to become even more intimate with the limits of my endurance, the unfathomable depths of my compassion, & the absolute gift of my people, the loves of my life.

I started to write this week. To make an attempt to shape the reality of these lessons into some sort of form that could begin to hold itself. My stories mingling with the words of others. Fragments & snippets & quotes. Forward & backward. Present & past. 

I thought I was telling a specific story, but the threads kept connecting, weaving themselves into a tapestry of their own making. Within a day I was nearing 8000 words. I’m close to 12K now—& this story (whatever it is & whatever it may become) keeps compelling me to tell it. 

I don’t know where I go from here, how or when or if I will share any of it. But this writing? It is hard and holy and necessary, and I will see it through until I am done with it or it is done with me—whichever comes first. 

In the meantime I return, with deep intention, to the tools at my disposal. To ritual and rhythms. To connections and community. To intuition and wisdom and the compass of my own good, good heart. And to the light which—when I remember to look toward it—is always ready to illuminate what is real. 
 
I remember the words of @elizabeth_gilbert_writer “I was never not coming here. This was never not going to happen”.

I believe this to be what is true. This right now chose me, and I it. Now we get to see what is born from here.

If someone takes your story from you, take it back. 

If somehow, without your desire or design, someone steals the breath from your lungs and uses it to spin the narrative until it flies out of reach, you spell yourself a tornado to swirl it back around until it lands in your chest to once more power your voice. 

If they try to claim domain over what is yours—to paint themselves the victor, to hoard the profits from what you alone made, to be the one to hold the key to the vault of your creation—never fear. 

Without you to give it life, what they grasp is only a dying star. 

You are place this cosmos was birthed, every new universe is delivered from the spark within you. 

If, once upon a time, you had to edit out pieces of the truth in order to stay safe, contained, or make it all fit in the space they offered you, its never too late to add a chapter, or a verse, or a song until it feels whole and complete.

There are always new blank pages in the book. 

A true story is never done being written.

And yours will never belong to anyone but you.

(Inspired by Speak Now (Taylor’s Version) and all of the souls in this world who have bravely and tenaciously reclaimed the right hold sovereign domain over their own story. My heroes. Every last one).

I haven’t been around here much. 
Truth is, I’m not going to say I’m back. 

Honestly, I’m working hard to not place any pressure on establishing a timeline for return, & not attach much of a story to being away in the first place.

Right now I’m practicing not attaching much story to anything at all.

Some seasons require a release of the need to make meaning from the stuff of life—yes, that’s a tricky skill to master for one who has built a life of meaning-making. But for the first time in a very long time (perhaps a lifetime), I’ve not been able to grasp the threads that weave a current narrative.

What’s more, I have not really wanted to.

Right now, the life I’m living isn’t interested in being molded into a collection of words. It resists the notion that it could or should be crafted into any sort of presentable arc. Not now. Not yet. I’m in a phase of process over product. Silence over sharing. 

Yes, this has been a quiet season, out of unpredictable circumstance and overdue necessity. More hermit crab than wild woman. Less brave explorer of the world, more learning to be quietly uncomfortable existing within my own inner terrain (fuck, ya’ll, even with practice, it’s wickedly uncomfortable). 

Right now, it’s enough to stay steady, give lots of space, & practice trust in what I know to be true—the story of me will always return. 

But I didn’t come here today to tell you why I’m not telling you much of anything.

I came here because it felt like the right day to remind you (to remind myself) to keep doing what you’re doing. 

The hard, stupidly uncomfortable work of excavating old trauma & breaking ancestral curses. The stopping of THE THING or the starting of THE THING or the metaphormic transformation and creation of an entirely new life. Or more likely, all of the above.

Whether you’ve been doing it for 3 minutes, or maybe 3 months, or 3 whole years. If the work you are doing is meant to move you closer to your center, or to build a center that will one day hold—then just keep going. Messily & imperfectly and entirely ungracefully, without a single clue how/what/when/where you’ll end up. 

Keep doing the thing. You and me? We’re gonna get there.

Dear Isabella.
22 years as your mother. WTF Kinda crazy magic is that? 

You’ve always been larger that life. Born with a fierce intelligence and even fiercer drive (when you could sit, you were mad you couldn’t crawl, when you could crawl you were angry you couldn’t walk, when you could walk you were well past ready to run). 

You played rough and held little back. Affection, and life, on your own terms, always. You didn’t come here to do things small or quiet, you came to make yourself known. You’ve always been yourself. 100%, unapologetically, unwaveringly, yourself. 

Before you were born, I made the rash proclamation that I expected my kids to question authority (yes, even mine). Good god, I must have seen you coming. 

You asked me recently when you started to talk, truthfully—I can’t remember a time before your words (and your wisdom) were a part of my world. I swear, you came out spouting truth and pushing boundaries and approaching the whole wide world as a puzzle you intended to solve. I think you were born articulating your emotions and interrogating life. And I’m beyond thankful for it (most of the time). Not a chance I would have learned as much as I have if you were different. 

You are so much like me it’s scary. So unlike me it’s fascinating. And so much wholly yourself that it’s a god damn inspiration.   This year you graduate college. I watch you, making your way, finding your place, discovering the pathways back to yourself. I have a million and one wishes for the life that lies ahead. I hope you have wild adventures, embrace the kind of freedom only found in authenticity. I hope you are well loved, and do just enough scary things to keep you fully alive. I hope you continue to live like you have always lived, bravely and honestly and with a giant heart and a pragmatic sort of wisdom and perspective that has always seemed far beyond your years. 

And most of all, I hope the world opens up for you, wide and waiting, and I hope you step in with all of you, and live full-on, into whatever adventures come next. 

And when life breaks your heart (and it will) know you can always come back home.  xo, Gratefully, Humbly, Always Your mama.
